newsitem.title: USA: GOP tax conferees tentatively agree on DC perks.
newsitem.headline: GOP tax conferees tentatively agree on DC perks.

text.p: U.S. Republican tax negotiators tentatively agreed to a series of proposals to aide the financially struggling District of Columbia, according to a published report Friday.
The proposed agreement by House and Senate Republican panelists will be presented to White House negotiators as talks continue on a final tax bill.
The draft plan was reprinted Friday by the Bureau of National Affairs.
It would establish a D.C. Enterprise Zone eligible for expanded tax exempt financing, a wage credit for employers that hire low income residents, and other incentives.
It also would provide a $5,000 credit for some first-time homebuyers in the District, the draft says.
House Republican negotiators agreed to drop an earlier proposal to reduce the 15 percent income tax bracket to 10 percent for residents of the D.C. zone, the draft says.
